catalysts.thesis: Classic PEAD setup: Calix reported a Q4 earnings beat ($0.39 EPS vs estimates) and strong AI platform demand on Feb 12, yet the stock is flat/down (-0.18%), creating a divergence between fundamentals and price action.
catalysts.catalyst_details: Q4 Earnings Beat reported Feb 12, 2026; confirmed 'Demand Momentum' for AI platforms.
catalysts.absorption_status: Unpriced. Stock is trading flat/down despite the operational beat, likely due to broader telecom sector weakness masking company-specific strength.
catalysts.risk: Continued slowdown in carrier capex spending.
catalysts.mispricing_evidence: Analyst consensus target ~$77.50 vs Current ~$54; Price ignored positive EPS surprise.

catalysts.thesis: Double Catalyst: Company gained 'Preferred Vendor' status with a major cloud provider (Feb 11) and saw significant insider buying (72k shares) on Feb 10 while trading at 52-week lows.
catalysts.catalyst_details: Insider Buy (Feb 10) + Preferred Cloud Vendor Announcement (Feb 11).
catalysts.absorption_status: Ignored. Stock is pinned at 52-week lows ($6.84), treating the news as noise rather than a fundamental shift.
catalysts.risk: Small-cap liquidity and IT services sector headwinds.
catalysts.mispricing_evidence: Trading at <1x Revenue despite new major vendor status and insider accumulation.
